text: [Music]
so Edna or environmental DNA is a
rapidly evolving field of applied
science research and is increasingly
becoming a key part of our tool kit to
understand how biodiversity is changing
and why so how species communities and
whole ecosystems are changing through
time and it's a central part of our
progress towards charting a good pathway
for nature actually from decline to
Nature recovery it's the big data
science yields High volumes of data
metadata and so on are critical to how
we exchange and use that information
we're working closely with our partner
Amazon web services to develop a
cloud-based data ecosystem that handles
endtoend pipelines for that data brings
in the analytical and data sharing tools
we need to ensure these data can be used
by others on the ground
